title: Introduction to klassR
text: Norwegian data set codes Standard Industrial Classification want find mean? data Norwegian municipality numbers names? perhaps want convert English standard occupations Ny Norsk figure. tasks R package klassR can help . Statistics Norway’s KLASS central database classifications code lists. API makes easy fetch standards different computing environments. klassR provides easy interface fetch apply R. Statistic Norway employees, package installed platforms. others, can installed CRAN : CRAN R’s central repository thousands useful packages. information requirements klassR can found CRAN use function klassR package must called time new R session started. can done using:

title: Introduction to klassR
text: fetch classification KLASS need unique classification number. can found URL KLASS website can search R using one following functions.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: function list_klass fetch list classifications. returns classification name (klass_name), number (klass_nr) classification family belongs (klass_family). classification type (klass_type) also shown indicates whether classification code list. Code lists classifications used national internal (Statistics Norway) publications. can included list using codelist parameter

what: Search for a classification using a keyword
title: Introduction to klassR
text: can also search classification keyword using search_klass function. first parameter query search . , include code lists search specified Sometimes classification code list appear several times. due occurs several times different langauges database.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: fetch complete classification, use get_klass function together unique identifier. example, fetch Standard Industrial Classifications (KLASS number 6) run:

title: Introduction to klassR
text: Classifications often organised heirachical way. example , Standard Industrial Classifications different values level. fetch specific level, use output_level parameter. example, fetch top level Standard Industrial Classification codes use:

title: Introduction to klassR
text: examples seen names returned Norwegian (Bokmål). However, many classification KLASS multiple languages. output language can specified Bokmål (“nb”), Nynorsk (“nn”) English (“en”) using language parameter. Note: 3 languages available classifcations.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: standard output style ‘long’ levels classifications listed . alternative format can chosen using parameter output_style='wide'. give one row per detailed classification codes names higher/broader levels given variables.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: classifications additional notes can fetched classification. can included data using option notes = T.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: data set want apply classification variable possible apply_klass. can used get name variable code form example. built test data set klassR called klassdata. contains fictitious persons sex, education level, municipality numbers, industry classification workplace occupation. can use apply_klass create variable municipality names (classification number 131) persons based codes. specify vector codes first parameter followed unique classification number. , language output_level can specified.
code: data(klassdata) head(klassdata) klassdata$kommune_names <- apply_klass(klassdata$kommune,   classification = 131 ) head(klassdata)

title: Introduction to klassR
text: Classifications often change time. KLASS database considers older classifications can fetched using date parameter.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: Fetching using classification specific time point can done using date parameter specifying date version classification applies. date format form “yyyy-mm-dd”, example “2022-05-27” 27th May, 2022. many changes regions Norway (classification number 106) past years. can see fetching classifications different times

title: Introduction to klassR
text: Sometime may useful fetch codes period time. can specifing two dates vector date paramter. following code fetched Norwegian regional codes 1st January 2019 1st January 2020. 26 different codes show old newer names.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: fetch changes time period rather codes can specify correspond=TRUE allong time interval interested . table returned correspondents codes /names time interval specified. sourceCode sourceName refer original name coding. targetCode targetName refer newer code name. Notice simple 1:1 correspondence regions. municipality number needed map changes accurately.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: Classification valid future also included KLASS. can fetched specifying future date. message shown indicate future classification. additional parameters need specified.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: addition small changes time, classifications change completely correspondence table defined within KLASS database. can fetched applied using get_klass apply_klass functions together correspond parameter give unique classification number convert . fetch correspondence table municipality codes (131) greater regional codes (106) can run: can apply correspondence municipality region example data set using apply_klass.
code: get_klass(131, correspond = 106, date = "2020-01-01") klassdata$region <- apply_klass(klassdata$kommune,   classification = 131,   correspond = 106,   date = "2020-01-01" ) klassdata

title: Introduction to klassR
text: also possible fetch variant classification. need provide classification number variant number.

what: Match and convert a classification — apply_klass
title: Match and convert a classification — apply_klass
text: Match convert classification

title: Match and convert a classification — apply_klass
code: apply_klass(   x,   classification,   date = NULL,   variant = NULL,   correspond = NULL,   language = "nb",   output_level = NULL,   output = "name",   format = TRUE )  ApplyKlass(   x,   klass,   date = NULL,   variant = NULL,   correspond = NULL,   language = "nb",   output_level = NULL,   output = "name",   format = TRUE )

title: Match and convert a classification — apply_klass
text: x Input vector classification codes. Vector must match "code" column call get_klass(). classification Classification number date String required date classification. Format must "yyyy-mm-dd". inverval, provide two dates vector. blank, default today's date. variant classification variant fetch (variant wanted). correspond ID number target correspondence table. correspondence two dates within classification, use correspond = TRUE. language Default "nb" Norwegian (Bokmål). Also "nn" (Nynorsk) "en" (English available classifications) output_level Desired output level output String describing output. May "name" (default), "code" "". format Logical whther run formatting av input vector x (Default = TRUE), important check formatting one level. klass Deprecated; use `classification` instead.

title: Match and convert a classification — apply_klass
text: vector data frame returned names /code desired output level.

title: Match and convert a classification — apply_klass
code: data(klassdata) kommune_names <- apply_klass(   x = klassdata$kommune,   classification = 131,   language = "en",   format = FALSE )

what: Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — get_klass
title: Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — get_klass
text: Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API

title: Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — get_klass
code: get_klass(   classification,   date = NULL,   correspond = NULL,   correspondID = NULL,   variant = NULL,   output_level = NULL,   language = "nb",   output_style = "normal",   notes = FALSE,   quiet = TRUE )  GetKlass(   klass,   date = NULL,   correspond = NULL,   correspondID = NULL,   variant = NULL,   output_level = NULL,   language = "nb",   output_style = "normal",   notes = FALSE,   quiet = TRUE )

title: Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — get_klass
text: classification Number/string classification ID/number. (use klass_list() find ) date String required date classification. Format must "yyyy-mm-dd". inverval, provide two dates vector. blank, default today's date. correspond Number/string target classification correspondence table (correspondence table requested). correspondID ID number correspondence table retrieve. Use alternative correspond. variant classification variant fetch (variant wanted). output_level Number/string specifying requested hierarchy level (optional). language Two letter string requested language output. Default Bokmål ("nb"). Nynorsk ("nn") English ("en") also available classification.) output_style String variable output type. Default "normal". Specify "wide" wide formatted table output. notes Logical notes returned column. Default FALSE quiet Logical whether suppress printing API address. Default TRUE. klass Deprecated; use `classification` instead.

title: Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — get_klass
text: function returns data frame specified classification/correspondence table. Output variables include: code, parentCode, level, name standard lists. correspondence tables variables include: sourceCode, sourceName, targetCode targetName. date correspondence tables variables include: oldCode, oldName, newCode newName. "wide" output, code name level suffixes specified. date ranges, validFromInRequestedRange validToInRequestedRange give dates classification. Variable ChangeOccured gives effective date classification change classification change tables.

title: Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — get_klass
code: # Get classification for occupation classifications head(get_klass(classification = "7")) #>   code parentCode level                                        name #> 1    0       <NA>     1                  Militære yrker og uoppgitt #> 2   00          0     2 Uoppgitt / yrker som ikke kan identifiseres #> 3  000         00     3 Uoppgitt / yrker som ikke kan identifiseres #> 4 0000        000     4 Uoppgitt / yrker som ikke kan identifiseres #> 5   01          0     2         Offiserer fra fenrik og høyere grad #> 6  011         01     3         Offiserer fra fenrik og høyere grad # Get classification for occupation classifications in English head(get_klass(classification = "7", language = "en")) #>   code parentCode level                                      name #> 1    0       <NA>     1              Armed forces and unspecified #> 2   00          0     2 Unspecified or unidentifiable occupations #> 3  000         00     3 Unspecified or unidentifiable occupations #> 4 0000        000     4 Unspecified or unidentifiable occupations #> 5   01          0     2        Commissioned armed forces officers #> 6  011         01     3        Commissioned armed forces officers

title: Given a graph and a node, determine if the node is a result of combinations of multiple codes. — is_combined
text: function attempt reconcile nodes split   later merged evaluating node's combinedness. compare_node == NULL, node considered combined   one node parent (.e. codes start   sequence changes) contribute node. compare_node != NULL, node considered combined   node ancestor compare_node contributes   node, .e. paths node parents node   pass compare_node.

title: Testdata for klassR package — klassdata
Testdata for klassR package — klassdata
text: data frame containing 100 rows 7 variables: ID Identification number sex 1/2 variable sex education 4-digit number education standard ISCED97 (level subject area) NUS (klass = 66) 2015.01.01 kommune 4-digit code Norwegian municipality (klass = 131). Based 2015.01.01 kommune2 Numeric variable Norwegian municipality dropped leading zero's testing (klass = 131). Based 2015.01.01 nace5 5-digit code industry (NACE). Based 01.01.2015 standard industry codes (klass = 7) occupation 4-digit occupation codes using standard STYRK-08 (klass = 7) 2015.01.01

title: Update a code found in a directed graph based on a Klass-classification — update_code
code: update_code(   graph,   code,   date = NA,   output = "code",   combine = TRUE,   report = FALSE )

title: Update a code found in a directed graph based on a Klass-classification — update_code
text: graph graph generated klass_graph. code Klass code date Optional. specific date supplied code valid . output Either character vector, containing one items   list , TRUE include columns.  "code" Klass code. "name" Klass name. "validFrom" date code valid . "validTo" date code valid . "split" Logical: code split two codes? "combined" Logical: two codes become code? "nextCode" split == FALSE, gives code code changed . NA otherwise. combine TRUE FALSE. See return section. report TRUE FALSE. See return section.

title: Update a code found in a directed graph based on a Klass-classification — update_code
text: report == TRUE length(output) > 1 | TRUE,   result data.frame number rows equal number   codes sequence changes input code output code.   columns data.frame specified output. report == TRUE length(output) == 1, result   character vector length equal number codes sequence   changes input code output code. contents   character vector specified output. report == FALSE length(output) > 1 | TRUE result   data.frame one row representing last code   change sequence columns specified output. code   split, result NA. combine == FALSE   code result combination codes, result   NA. report == FALSE length(output) == 1, result   character vector length one, containing information   updated code specified output. code split,   result NA. combine == FALSE code   result combination codes, result NA.

what: Update multiple Klass codes to a desired date. — update_klass
title: Update multiple Klass codes to a desired date. — update_klass
text: Update multiple Klass codes desired date.

title: Update multiple Klass codes to a desired date. — update_klass
code: update_klass(   codes,   dates = NA,   classification = NULL,   date = NULL,   graph = klass_graph(classification, date),   output = "code",   report = FALSE,   combine = TRUE )

title: Update multiple Klass codes to a desired date. — update_klass
text: codes Codes updated. dates Optional. Can used specify date codes valid . Supply character vector either length 1 specify valid date codes, length codes specify valid dates code. character vector(s) format coercible .Date, e.g. YYYY-MM-DD. function return error code valid specified date. classification ID desired classification. date Optional. Can used specify date codes updated , e.g. codes valid year T, want change codes corresponding version year T-1. unspecified (default), function update codes recent version. graph Optional. graph object generated klass_graph. making multiple calls [update_klass], can save time generating graph beforehand reusing call [update_klass] parameter. providing graph directly, need provide classification date parameters. output Either character vector, containing one items   list , TRUE include columns.  "code" Klass code. "name" Klass name. "validFrom" date code valid . "validTo" date code valid . "split" Logical: code split two codes? "combined" Logical: two codes become code? "nextCode" split == FALSE, gives code code changed . NA otherwise. report TRUE FALSE. See return section. combine TRUE FALSE. See return section.

title: Update multiple Klass codes to a desired date. — update_klass
text: output = "code", vector length length(codes)   containing either code update successful NA   code split. combine = FALSE, code combined   another code also return NA. output == TRUE, list length length(codes) containing   data.frames detailing codes visited node search.   tables following columns. — report == TRUE length(output) > 1 | TRUE, result   list data.frames number rows equal   number codes sequence changes input codes   output codes. columns data.frames specified   output. report == TRUE length(output) == 1, result   list character vectors length equal number codes   sequence changes input code output code. contents   character vectors specified output. report == FALSE length(output) > 1 | TRUE result   list data.frames one row representing last   code change sequence columns specified output.   code split, result NA. combine ==   FALSE code result combination codes, result   NA. report == FALSE length(output) == 1, result   character vector containing information updated codes   specified output. code split, result   NA. combine == FALSE code result   combination codes, result NA.

title: Update multiple Klass codes to a desired date. — update_klass
code: library(klassR) codes <- get_klass(131, date = "2020-01-01")[["code"]]  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ updated_codes <- update_klass(codes,   dates = "2020-01-01",   classification = 131 ) } # }

what: Given a node and a graph, find the node at the end of a sequence of changes. — update_klass_node
title: Given a node and a graph, find the node at the end of a sequence of changes. — update_klass_node
text: Given node graph, find node end sequence changes.

title: Given a node and a graph, find the node at the end of a sequence of changes. — update_klass_node
Given a node and a graph, find the node at the end of a sequence of changes. — update_klass_node
text: graph graph generated klass_graph. node node returned klass_node V.

title: Given a node and a graph, find the node at the end of a sequence of changes. — update_klass_node
text: sequence vertices, starting node ending   last visited node.

title: Given a node and a graph, find the node at the end of a sequence of changes. — update_klass_node
code: # Build a graph directed towards the most recent codes. library(klassR) klass_131 <- klass_graph(131)  # Find the most recent node in the graph representing the code "0101" (Halden, # valid to 2020.) halden_node <- klass_node(klass_131, "0101")  # Find the most recent code corresponding to 0101 Halden halden_node_updated <- update_klass_node(klass_131, halden_node)

title: klassR 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-15 Changes main functions names adhere standard formats. Addition new functions mapping changes time using graphs.
